source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Body of lower lemma glabrous but callus hairs long, exceeding base of awns; glumes 11–21-nerved (across middle); grass of sandy sites in north-west only
Body of lower lemma hairy at least in lower part, callus hairs not reaching to base of awns; glumes 5–9-nerved across middle

Nodes of culms glabrous or shortly pubescent; body of lemma thickened at maturity, concealing the nerves on the dorsal surface, lemma margins virtually glabrous; awns about as long as body of lemma, the outer ones entered by 2 nerves, or occasionally awns 11 in number; confined to upper Snowy River area in the east

Nodes of culms densely bearded; body of mature lemma membranous to papery, conspicuously nerved, margins ciliate in upper half; awns always 9 in number, about twice as long as body of lemma, the outer pair single-nerved; scattered through drier areas
